alert.note: Alert for Boone; Kanawha (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 28 at 11:59AM EDT until August 28 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR EAST CENTRAL BOONE AND SOUTHEASTERN KANAWHA COUNTIES... At 1159 AM EDT, Radar and gauge reports indicated between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen this morning. Although the heavy rain has since ended, runoff will continue to result in flash flooding. Emergency management reported water rescues in the communities of Dry Branch and Sharon earlier in the morning. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar and public reports. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Montgomery, Glasgow, Pratt, Handley, Dawes, Eskdale, Sharon and Prenter. This includes the following streams and drainages... Morris Creek, Hughes Creek, Laurel Creek, Cabin Creek, Paint Creek, Big Jarrells Creek, Joes Creek, and Dry Branch. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Report flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
